#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=The Chatham Islands
#Text=The Chatnam Islands ( Rekohu in the indigenous Moriori language ) are the eastern - most settled islands in New Zealand .
#Text=The islands are in their own time zone , 45 minutes ahead of New Zealand time ;
#Text=the International Date Line jogs eastward to keep them on the same calendar day as the rest of New Zealand .
#Text=The islands lie 860 km east of Christchurch , in the middle of the " Roaring Forties " .
#Text=Steeped in culture and history , these islands are on the very edge of civilisation .
#Text=Experience Moriori culture , experience Rekohu .
#Text=Understand
#Text=The Chatham Islands consist of the main island , Chatham Island itself , with a population of 600 , smaller Pitt Island with about 40 inhabitants , and a number of rocky outcrops .
#Text=The islands are volcanic in origin and have a unique and sensitive habitat that supports many rare and endangered species .
#Text=The original people of the islands are the Moriori , who were descended from the Maori of mainland New Zealand , but who developed their own culture and variant of the language .
#Text=In 1835 Maori settlers from the mainland arrived , massacred and enslaved the Moriori .
#Text=Get in
#Text=By plane
#Text=The only way for visitors to travel to the Chathams is via scheduled or chartered air service .
#Text=Air Chathams fly 5 days per week , from either Christchurch , Auckland or Wellington and , seasonally , from Napier .
#Text=The plane is based in the Chathams and flies to mainland New Zealand in the morning , then back to the Chathams in the afternoon .
#Text=As part of New Zealand , there are no passport or visa requirements and no border controls on arrival from the mainland .

#Text=You should book or ensure accommodation before you board a flight for the Chathams , as during the popular months of the tourism season , between October and April , accommodation can be severely limited .
#Text=There are no same - day return flights , so once there you have to stay at least one night .
#Text=Although flying to the Chathams and back is not cheap , it is worth it .
#Text=Even the mainland school groups that fly there for school camps , and choose to stay at Kopinga Marae [ 1 ] get value for money by chartering a flight one way .
#Text=Anyway , you do n't have a choice on how you get there , unless you happen to own an aeroplane .
#Text=However , when you get off that aeroplane , if you have n't pre-organised transport , you will have to walk , and it is a long way into town .
#Text=By boat
#Text=The only scheduled shipping service to the Chatham Islands remains the Black Robin Freighters " Rangatira " , an antiquated , slow and small coastal trading vessel .
#Text=This boat has serviced the islands for many years , but does not carry passengers .
#Text=Freight charges on the Rangatira appear to be flexible and subject to change .
#Text=Vessels can call at the Chathams and there are a number of " safe " harbours for shelter if the need arises .
#Text=Remember to notify the local policeman , or Ministry of Fisheries officer if you are entering New Zealand via the Chathams .
#Text=If you want a wharf berthage then call the local harbour master as you near the Chathams and he will sort you out .
#Text=Get around
#Text=There are several businesses on Chatham Island that will rent you a vehicle .
#Text=Do not expect the flashest and latest in rental cars though .
#Text=The cars " will " be warranted and safe , but they wo n't be exceptionally " flash " .
#Text=Chatham Motors have a range of nice rental vans available as well and they provide pretty good service for both visitors and locals .
#Text=See
#Text=Basalt columns
#Text=Some of the world 's most rare and endangered birds , plants and insects .
#Text=Unique tree carvings done by the peaceful Moriori people hundreds of years ago .
#Text=Henga Scenic Reserve .
#Text=Set adjacent to Henga Lodge is the magnificent Henga Scenic Reserve .
#Text=Guests of the lodge can meander around either a short easy walk , or take the longer 2 hr return walk out onto the spectacular beach .
#Text=Access is free to Lodge guests .
#Text=Hapupu National Historic Scenic Reserve .

#Text=One of only two National Historic Scenic Reserves in New Zealand ( the other is the Waitangi Treaty Grounds ) , Hapupu is a special place , and somewhere that you will want to tell others about .
#Text=Spiritually and culturally important to Moriori , it holds the last known concentration of momori - rakau , or tree carvings done by the ancestors of today 's Moriori .
#Text=There are many views on why they did these carvings , but whatever the reason , you will find them a very special attraction .
#Text=Port Hutt .
#Text=One of the most scenicly attractive ports in the whole of New Zealand , Port Hutt boasts an incredibly sheltered little harbour , with picturesque views and safe anchorage in all weather .
#Text=Historically important and economically crucial for these islands today , Port Hutt is the ideal location for a short browse around and a mecca for those photography buffs [ 2 ] .
#Text=Kopinga Marae .
#Text=If you could define a place that will remind you of your visit to the Chathams , then this very special place will be at the top of your list .
#Text=Opened in 2005 , Kopinga is the official meeting place of Te Imi Moriori .
#Text=Adorned with contemporary Moriori carvings and traditional taonga ( treasures ) , the marae is a magnificent , tasteful and contemporary testament to the ancestors of Te Imi Moriori .
#Text=Enjoy a guided tour of this beautiful and peaceful building .
#Text=School - Camps At Kopinga Marae [ 3 ] also utilise this wonderful national treasure for hosting visiting school groups .
#Text=Tommy Solomon Statue .
#Text=Tame Horomona Rehe was the last known full - blooded Moriori and he passed away in 1933 .
#Text=He was however , not the last Moriori .
#Text=His own descendants and the descendants of other Moriori live on today .
#Text=Come and have a look at this statue , erected in 1985 to commemorate his passing .
#Text=Come and see Manakau , the property of his descendants , located on the eastern corner of Rekohu and blessed with the sun 's first rays as they rise above the sea each day .

#Text=The Chatham Islands east of New Zealand ( population 640 ) , which are reachable by plane from New Zealand , feature the magestic Henga Scenic Reserve and beach , Hapupu National Historic Scenic Reserve , the picturesque Port Hutt and Kopinga Marae , meeting place of the indigenous Moriori people .
